Aman smiled warmly and said, "Come with me. I will get you some food." The girl looked at him with teary eyes and whispered, "Really? That would be wonderful!" Aman nodded and said, "Of course! sub_questions.explanation: Aman asked the little girl why she was sitting there alone and also asked her if she was feeling okay. The girl looked at him with teary eyes and whispered in disbelief if he really meant it and added that it would be wonderful. Aman nodded and reassured her that no one should go hungry.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph in about 200 words on "Challenges in Educational System of Bangladesh" by using descriptive method.

sub_questions.explanation:
Challenges in the Educational System of Bangladesh
Education is very important for the progress of a country. But in Bangladesh, there are many challenges in the education system. First, many children, especially in villages, do not go to school. Some schools are far away, and some families are too poor to send their children to school. Many students drop out early because they have to work and help their families. Second, there are not enough schools, classrooms, and teachers. Many schools have too many students in one class. This makes it hard for teachers to give proper attention to each student. Some schools do not have good facilities like clean toilets, libraries, and playgrounds. Third, the quality of education is not the same everywhere. Some schools give better education, but many students in government schools do not get proper learning materials. It is also a fact that many teachers are not well-trained. Lastly, the political disorder in our country creates challenges for our education system. Publishing error-free books is also a challenge for the government in education sector. However, the government is trying to improve the standard of education. If we all work together, every child in Bangladesh can get a good education and build a better future.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on " Student Politics ". Use not more than 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Student Politics in Bangladesh
When students take part in political activities, it is called 'Student politics'. In Bangladesh, student politics has a long history. During the Language Movement of 1952 and the Liberation War of 1971, students played a big role. They fought for the country's freedom and rights. Today, student politics exists in almost all universities and colleges. Many students join different political groups. Some of them work for student rights, like better education, lower fees, and good facilities. But sometimes, student politics causes problems. Some students misuse politics for personal gain. There are fights and violence between different groups. This creates a bad environment in educational institutions. Many students feel unsafe, and their studies are disturbed. Student politics can be good if students work for the welfare of others. They should focus on helping people and improving education. But if they get involved in violence, it is harmful for the country. The government and universities should make sure that student politics is peaceful and helpful. Education should be the first priority for students. If student politics is done in the right way, it can help build a better future for Bangladesh.
